Topic.Title: Russia must be the most unfair country on the planet

Message.Msg: "why Forbes should be ashamed they published this article?" Because it is bad statistics and bad writing. Remember our discussion of precision? They threw out a bunch of buzzwords--welfare, government worker, pensioner, taker, maker--without defining them or explaining how they are related to state finances. A bunch of undefined buzzwords together to get an emotional reaction is a fluff piece. Any decent news organization should be ashamed to print such a piece. I generally have respect for Forbes but their online content tends to be poor. "when someone on the left tells a falsehood, they are given a pass with words like hyperbole" By whom are they given a pass? Not by me. I recently called echo to task for posting some BS from moveon.org. If winholder made a mistake let him admit it. The reality is, though, I spend most of my time here correcting repeated and gross falsehoods posted by conservatives. Most of these take about thirty seconds of research to correct. The people who do this either know the truth and are lying or remain intentionally ignorant of the truth to permit them to spread falsehoods. I see little point in distinguishing between the two. "I am so glad that you have never been guilty of such behavior." Never is a strong term. What I don't do is revel in it. "I have never made a threat to move to China or Russia." I may be confusing you with someone else. My mistake.

Topic.Title: Grover's cliff...

Message.Msg: They passed budgets when Democrats controlled both houses. Republicans have blocked every budget since they took control of the House. "But lets move forward, this is Obama's Presidency, he's been in charge for four years, no more blaming Bush." That would be nice. The first two years we were moving forward and Obama was clearly accountable for policy outcomes. GDP and job growth was strong. Since then, a minority of House Republicans have prevented this. They should be and are being held accountable for causing repeated fiscal crises and economic uncertainty.

Message.Title: AT&T Dividend & Stock Price
Message.Msg: Looking back over the past year the chart shows a drop in price after each dividend payment that exceeds the 44 cents of the dividend. In fact the October 5th dividend seems to have triggered a drop from $38 to $33. Presumably these drops are the result of the forecast made at the time the dividend is paid. Monday will be another dividend; can we expect another drop?

Topic.Title: AT&T Dividend & Stock Price

Message.Msg: Here is the chart. http://finance.yahoo.com/echarts?s=T#symbol=t;range=1y;compare=;indicator=dividend+bollinger+sma%28200,20%29+volume+stochasticslow+rsi;charttype=candlestick;crosshair=on;ohlcvalues=1;logscale=off;source=undefined;

Message.Msg: "I fail to see why many posters stick up for the republican refusal to raise the tax rate on people making $450,000." Turn that coin over and you will find "I fail to see why many posters stick up for the Democrats refusal to reduce government spending."

Topic.Title: Russia must be the most unfair country on the planet

Message.Msg: Barack Obama Sr. was an economist. He was not a "goat-herder".

Topic.Title: Grover's cliff...

Message.Msg: "for the Democrats refusal to reduce government spending." The Democrats did not refuse to reduce government spending. Obama and Senate Democrats made proposals that included quite a bit of spending reductions. This is true for the fiscal cliff negotiations, but also for the debt ceiling debates. Remember, Democrats agreed to the spending cuts in sequestration, and implicitly agreed to any spending cuts that would have come from the Supercommittee. Tea Brain Republicans continue to refuse to accept any tax hikes on the wealthy. They were, however, quite willing to increase the payroll tax on workers.

Message.Title: Here is your trivia lesson for the day.
Message.Msg: Here is your trivia lesson for the day. Anthropomorphic Nouns; I thought this might be boring, but stick with it. You'll love the ending. We are all familiar with a herd of cows, a flock of chIckens, a achool of fish and a Gaggle of geese. However, less widely known is: A pride of lions, A murder of crows (as well as their cousins the rooks and ravens), an exaltation of doves and, presumably because they look so wise: a parliament of owls. Now consider a group of Baboons. Baboons are the loudest, most dangerous, most obnoxious, most viciously aggressive and least intelligent of all primates. And what is the proper collective noun for a group of baboons? Believe it or not... A Congress! A CONGRESS OF BABOONS! That pretty much explains the things that come out of Washington ! You just can’t make this stuff up.

Topic.Title: Grover's cliff...

Message.Msg: "Harry Reid would not allow budget bill to come up for a vote in the Senate." At one point Senate Republicans forced an up or down vote on Obama's budget verbatim. Does that mean they supported Obama's budget 100% as written? There are scores of idiotic maneuvers designed to be grist for the political propaganda mill. What matters is what they are willing to do at the negotiating table. The Tea Brains will not give--and still won't give--an inch on tax cuts for the wealthy. They are quite willing to let payroll taxes on middle class Americans rise, however.

Topic.Title: Russia must be the most unfair country on the planet

Message.Msg: What planet are you on, his tax increases will not pay for the Presidents fleet of aircraft and secret service agents and the helicopters and the limo's and the SUV's and the fighter escort aircraft and Air Mobility Command C-17 Globemaster III's and C-5M Super Galaxy's and of course the two Airforce 1 747 aircraft. Thinking of it another way the tax increases pay for eight days of what our Federal Government Spends. Rich people will move to a different country when you over tax them and they take their assets with them. Companies in the U.S. are already redcung hours for their workers from 40 or more to 27 hours to avoid taxes. Ask some of the people around you if this is happenning, you will find out. Everyone in this country has to contribute to get us out of this mess. I'll bet you have no idea that we are in debt 1 million dollars per worker in the U.S. and the median income is $40,000 per year. Got any ideas how $40,000.00 a year is going to pay a million dollar loan? By the way you will have a little surprise starting with your first paycheck this year no matter how much you make.

Topic.Title: Give them hell CWA

Message.Msg: I worked 30 years under CWA. We NEVER got more than the company offered. Many of us felt the union and company were in bed together. Both the local and national pulled dirty tricks to take advantage of members. Beirne took union funds and used them to promote his own personal beliefs. Shortly before I retired I requested that part of my dues that went to political activity be refunded which is the law. They didn't respond. I should have sued but was close to retirement and never followed up. WEish I had now.

Topic.Title: Grover's cliff...

Message.Msg: ricky18201. it was obvious why the republicans wanted to not contest the payroll tax rollback: they wanted to present themselves as "champions" of no tax increase. They liked to see the small man taxed and as punishment for taxing the wealthy, they said game on to hit the small guy. It is obvious we need spending reductions in medicare fraud and cutting of defense. I have said for yrs. that all earned income needs taxed to pay for ss/med. and with limits on benefits for the well to do. Having said that, to offset their added payroll tax I would like to see the wealthy have a reduced dividend tax of : to say 15% and capital gains of 20%, sort of carrot/stick approach. thanks
